result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald S Pukala was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent.
No weapons. No firearms. No ammunition.
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
Obtain and maintain full time employment and/or school.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronald S Pukala appeared by video, in custody. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Andrew Herrman. Atty. Joshua Deane appears for the defendant. Matter before the Court for waiver of prelminary hearing with pending files tracking - 21CF422, 21CF421. Record by Atty. Deane who was just appointed for Atty. Kim and has waiver of preliminary hearing. Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Information filed. Atty. Deane asks that arraignment be set over until next week. Court grants request
Arraignment scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronald S Pukala in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Ronald S Pukala. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the defense. Rights given and hearing requested, within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22GF320, 21CF421 & 21CF422
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.M.P. (dob 10/10/1988). Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-1611 thru 22-1613

Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ronald S Pukala in court, in custody by video with Attorney Tony Kim. Defendant does qualify for SPD attorney. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. State asking for $15,000 cash bail. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
